metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39418 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL with the use of the MERGE command, which fails to test new rows against row security policies defined for UPDATE and SELECT. If UPDATE and SELECT policies forbid some rows that INSERT policies do not forbid, a user could store such rows.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libecpg6 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libpq5 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-15 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-client-15 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-plperl-15 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-15 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-15 - 15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> This only affects v15

criterions.comment: postgresql-15 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.4-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
